name: ARM CPUs and instances
summary: Most major cloud vendors have started introducing ARM-based CPUs, both directly as instances and also accessible through different services like Lambda or other managed services. Those usually bring in better (or at the very least similar) performance, at a reduced cost and lowered environmental impact. Some software might need to be specifically compiled for the platform, but required changes are usually very limited.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.body: See link, usually around 20% lower than equivalent x86 based CPUs or services.
